key_insight: Introduce O-Voxel, a sparse omni-voxel that natively encodes both geometry and appearance to learn compact, structured latents—enabling high-fidelity 3D generation of complex topologies and detailed appearance.
problem_solved: Existing 3D representations struggle to capture complex topologies and fine appearance while remaining memory- and compute-efficient; this work provides a native 3D latent that addresses fidelity, compactness, and topology preservation.
method: Define O-Voxel: a sparse omni-voxel data structure that jointly encodes geometry and appearance in native 3D.
Train a representation-learning pipeline that maps O-Voxel inputs to compact, structured latents for generative modeling.
Leverage sparse, native 3D operations to retain topology/detail while reducing memory and compute overhead for generation.
impact: Provides practitioners a practical representation and latent encoding for building more accurate, efficient 3D generative models—useful for asset creation, simulation, and production pipelines where topology and appearance matter.
visual_elements: Schematic of O-Voxel showing voxel cells containing both geometry + appearance channels
Side-by-side comparison: traditional voxel/mesh representation vs O-Voxel (visual quality and sparsity)
Latent-space visualization / interpolation demonstrating preservation of topology and appearance
Bar chart or table showing memory/compute savings and fidelity improvements
paper_title: Native and Compact Structured Latents for 3D Generation
paper_authors: Jianfeng Xiang, Xiaoxue Chen, Sicheng Xu, Ruicheng Wang, Zelong Lv
